intro: Pisonia diandra, commonly known as the flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fiery red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, cottony coating. Pisonia diandra thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing as a shrub or small tree. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm regions.
